question: bandOne of the consequences of improved medical care is that people are living longer and life expectancy is increasing. Do you think advantages outweigh disadvantages?
text: In the modern world , implementing improvements in the medical industry has increased  life expectancy.
Respect the past, a large part of the population can enjoy medical care, while in the past was accessible to only a few people.
However,  long life is only desirable if you can look after yourself.
In the essay below I will discuss all  the vantages and advantages and if the advantages outwegh the disadvantages.
Living longer is not a synonym for health.

Firstly, In the Hospitals,  there are many old people suffering from mental pathologies , while there are other patients with more serious illnesses ,that cannot be medical provided  because of short beds.
Secondly, Not all can  take care of their parents for various reasons, lack of money , not enough time etc. Moreover causing problems in their personal life.
In society not,  all can afford the costs that medical care has which is traduct in discrepancy.

There are a lot of positive aspects, grandparents , if they are in healthy condition, can teach the values to the children and help their parents during the job time and also older people have more experience than us and we can learn a lot from them.
In the conclusion, I think that some people deserve a longer life , after spending a life doing a hard job and building something.
I'm convinced that there are more positive aspects than negatives.

error_list.error_des: If you do not want outwegh to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
The noun phrase society seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
